710793f.title: Manhattan: 12th Avenue - 52nd Street
710793f.text:
Twalfth Avenue, south from W. 52nd Street, showing in a set
of 2 views (also negatives) the widening of this thoroughfare
preparatory to the extension of the West Side Elevated Himhway.
This,in conjunction with new 1000 foot piers will form one phase
of the West Side Improvement. The piled dehris seen in on the
easterly side of this thoroughfare.
June 30, 1930.
Views 1,2,3 and 4
V. L. Sperr

713632f.title: Manhattan: 52nd Street (West) - 12th Avenue
713632f.text:
632-636 West 52nd Street, south side, east of Twelfth
venue. No. 634 is a three-story and No. 636 is a two-story
frame house. No. 632, on the left,is marked 630.
1932.
J. Clarencg.Dayies Collection, Museum of the City of New York,
Negative No. 212

732847f-b.title: Recreation and hobbies - Children playing.
732847f-b.text:
(1)
Recreations--children playing: New York youngsters take to raft-
ing when other means of outdoor play are not available. This is a pond
in a cut for new piers below De Witt Clinton Park, 12th Avenue and 52nd
Street, Manhattan.
P. L. Sperr
NO REPRODUCTIONS  NEG S 3S70 123S
(2)
Eids playing on a sand pile, Washington and Bank Streets, Man-
hattan.
P. L. Sperr  1933
(3)
A playpwocnd in 6hery Street, Manhgttan, seen from the
Brooklyn Bridge.
P. L. Sperr

710792f-b.title: Manhattan: 12th Avenue - 52nd Street
710792f-b.text:
Twelfth Avenue, east side, between West 52nd and 54th
Street's showing details of the widening of this thor-
oughfare at Dewitt Clinton Park. A slice of the latter
was removed. View 1 is northeastward towards the build-
ings that frame the northerly edge of the Park. View 2
is southerlt towards the 52nd Street edge. The pavilion
in the center of the park is not included.
May 21, 1936
No's. 1-2
P. L. Sperr
